p: Certain key populations experience higher risk of human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) infection compared to the general population across all geographies, worldwide. For men who have sex with men (MSM), risk of HIV infection is 24-fold greater [ 1]. Stigma, discrimination, and violence associated with HIV infection cause this population to remain “hidden,” resulting in poorer uptake of HIV prevention, testing, treatment, and care, thereby creating a major, global public health challenge [ 2– 4].
